First, can you enable Gesture Detection?
(Click on the Motion Sensor part)

tooltips.text: Toggle this switch to choose Gesture mode
Let's code with gestures. Click the Done button

banner.text:
Where are you? First, let's store your position on the map.
Open the Variables tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.

Let's store your current longitude (where you are, from West to East).
Change item to mapLong.

Now, use a random location to make things interesting...
Open the Math tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change 0 to -100.
Change 10 to 100.
Nice. Now open the Variables tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.

Let's store your current latitude (where you are, from North to South).
Change item to mapLat.

Again, let's use a random location and see what happens.
Open the Math tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change 0 to -50.
Change 10 to 50.
Great... now change the map to satellite view üõ∞Ô∏è! Open the Map tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change Map to Satellite.

Cool! Let's zoom in a bit and get closer look.
Open the Map tray again.
Drag the block onto your code space.
Connect it to this block...
...and open the Variables tray again.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change 0 to 50.

Now, let's up a loop so the map updates when we use gestures.
Open the Control tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change seconds to frames.

Hmmm, how can you move the map to the location stored in the variables?
Simple. Open the Map tray.
Drag the block onto your code space.
Connect it to this block.
Now, open the Variables tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change item to mapLat.
Open the Variables tray again.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change item to mapLong.
Can you see the map moves to a random position, whenever the app starts?

You're doing great! Now let's add some gesture controls.
Open the Events tray.
You know what this block is for! Drag in onto your code space...
...and drop it anywhere.
Change app starts to Motion gesture left.

Remember, if you change the variables the map will update.
Open the Math tray.

You can use this block to change the variables with gestures.
Drag it onto your code space.
Connect it to this block...
...and change item to mapLong.
Now change += to -= to move the map left.

Hmmm... let's make the map moves a little bit at a time.
Change 1 to 0.2.

Now let's do the same for the other gestures ‚¨áÔ∏è‚û°Ô∏è‚¨ÜÔ∏è‚¨ÖÔ∏è..
Open the Events tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and drop it anywhere.
Change app starts to Motion gesture right.
Open the Math tray again.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change item to mapLong.
Change 1 to 0.2.
Open the Events tray and add another gesture...
Drag the block onto your code space.
Drop it anywhere on your code space.
Change app starts to Motion gesture up.
Keep going! Open the Math tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change item to mapLat.
Change 1 to 0.2.
Almost done! Open the Events tray...
...and drag this block onto your code space.
(You already know you can drop it anywhere)
Change app starts to Motion gesture down.
Open the Math tray again.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Change item to mapLat.
Change += to -=.
Change 1 to 0.2.

You did it üéâüéâüéâ!
Try moving your hand over the sensor to use the gestures, and move around the map üåé.

Now you've mastered Motion Sensor gestures... why not try changing the map zoom?
